api_token.Description: The Skytap API token. May also be specified by the `SKYTAP_API_TOKEN` shell environment variable

username.Description: The Skytap username. May also be specified by the `SKYTAP_USERNAME` shell environment variable

description.Description: User-defined description of the environment. Limited to 1000 characters. UTF-8 character type

label.Description: Set of labels for the instance

category.Description: Label category that provides contextual meaning

value.Description: Label valueto be used for reporting

name.Description: User-defined name of the environment. Limited to 255 characters. UTF-8 character type

outbound_traffic.Description: Indicates whether networks in the environment can send outbound traffic

routable.Description: Indicates whether networks within the environment can route traffic to one another

shutdown_at_time.Description: The date and time that the environment will be automatically shut down. Format: yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss. By default, the suspend time uses the UTC offset for the time zone defined in your user account settings. Optionally, a different UTC offset can be supplied (for example: 2018/07/20 14:20:00 -0000). The value in the API response is converted to your time zone

shutdown_on_idle.Description: The number of seconds an environment can be idle before it is automatically shut down. Valid range: 300 to 86400 seconds (5 minutes to 1 day)

suspend_at_time.Description: The date and time that the environment will be automatically suspended. Format: yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss. By default, the suspend time uses the UTC offset for the time zone defined in your user account settings. Optionally, a different UTC offset can be supplied (for example: 2018/07/20 14:20:00 -0000). The value in the API response is converted to your time zone

suspend_on_idle.Description: The number of seconds an environment can be idle before it is automatically suspended. Valid range: 300 to 86400 seconds (5 minutes to 1 day)

template_id.Description: ID of the template you want to create the environment from. If updated with a new ID, the environment will be recreated

user_data.Description: Environment user data, available from the metadata server and the Skytap API

source.Description: Source network from where the connection is initiated. This network does not need to be 'tunnelable' (visible to other networks)

target.Description: Target network to which the connection is made. The network does need to be 'tunnelable' (visible to other networks)

single_value.Description: Whether labels must have a single value for the category, or if they may have multiple values

domain.Description: Domain name for the Skytap network. This field can be changed only when all virtual machines in the environment are stopped (not suspended or running)

environment_id.Description: ID of the environment you want to attach the network to

subnet.Description: Defines the subnet address and subnet mask size in CIDR format (for example, 10.0.0.0/24). IP addresses for the VMs are assigned from this subnet and standard network services (DNS resolution, CIFS share, routes to Internet) are defined appropriately for it

tunnelable.Description: Whether or not this network can be connected to other networks

auto_add_role_name.Description: If this field is set to `viewer`, `participant`, `editor`, or `manager`, new users added to your Skytap account are automatically added to this project with the specified project role. Existing users arenâ€™t affected by this setting. For additional details, see [Automatically adding new users to a project](https://help.skytap.com/csh-project-automatic-role.html)

environment_ids.Description: A list of environments to add to the project

show_project_members.Description: Whether project members can view a list of other project members

cpus.Description: Number of CPUs allocated to this virtual machine

disk.Description: Set of virtual disks within the VM

lun.Description: The logical unit number (LUN) of the disk

name.Description: A unique name for the disk

size.Description: The size of the disk specified in MiB. The minimum disk size is 2048 MiB; the maximum is 2,096,128 MiB (1.999 TiB)

environment_id.Description: ID of the environment you want to add the VM to

label.Description: Set of labels for the instance

category.Description: Label category that provides contextual meaning

max_cpus.Description: Maximum settable CPUs for the VM

max_ram.Description: Maximum amount of RAM that can be allocated to the VM

network_interface.Description: Set of virtualized network interface cards (also known as a network adapters)

interface_type.Description: Type of network that this network adapter is attached to

ip.Description: The IP address (for example, 10.1.0.37). Skytap will not assign the same IP address to multiple interfaces on the same network

network_id.Description: ID of the network that this network adapter is attached to

published_service.Description: A binding of a port on a network interface to an IP and port that is routable and accessible from the public Internet. This mechanism is used to selectively expose ports on the guest to the public Internet

internal_port.Description: The port that is exposed on the interface

name.Description: A unique name for the published service

os_disk_size.Description: The size of the OS disk. The disk size is in MiB; it will be converted to GiB in the Skytap UI. The maximum disk size is 2,096,128 MiB (1.999 TiB)

ram.Description: Amount of RAM allocated to the VM

service_ips.Description: Map of external IP addresses. The key is the name of a published service - as defined in the `published_service` block

service_ports.Description: Map of external IP addresses. The key is the name of a published service - as defined in the `published_service` block

template_id.Description: ID of the template you want to create the VM from

user_data.Description: VM user data, available from the metadata server and the Skytap API

vm_id.Description: ID of the VM within the template that you want to create the VM from

auto_add_role_name.Description: The role automatically assigned to every new user added to the project

environment_ids.Description: IDs of the environments within the project

show_project_members.Description: Whether project members can view a list of the other project members

summary.Description: The summary description of the project

most_recent.Description: Use the most recently created template from the returned list

name.Description: A regex expression for the name of the template
